mainEntity.name: What is Long Lasting and how does it work?

acceptedAnswer.text: Long Lasting is a biostimulator that stimulates collagen and elastin production in the skin. Its advanced formula improves firmness, hydration, and skin texture for a prolonged period.

mainEntity.name: How many Long Lasting sessions are needed to see results?

acceptedAnswer.text: Generally, **2 sessions** are recommended with an interval of **4 to 6 weeks**. In more aged skins, more sessions may be necessary to enhance effects.

mainEntity.name: How long do the effects of Long Lasting last?

acceptedAnswer.text: Effects can last up to **12 months**, depending on the patient. An annual booster session is recommended to maintain results.

mainEntity.name: Is Long Lasting a hyaluronic acid filler?

acceptedAnswer.text: No, Long Lasting is not a filler. It is a biostimulator designed to improve skin quality without adding excessive volume.

mainEntity.name: Is the Long Lasting treatment painful?

acceptedAnswer.text: The application may generate mild discomfort, but it is generally well tolerated. Topical anesthetics can be used for greater comfort.

acceptedAnswer.text:

mainEntity.name: What is the difference between Long Lasting and Sculptra?

acceptedAnswer.text:
Long Lasting and Sculptra are biostimulators that induce collagen production:
âœ… Long Lasting: Has a more prolonged effect and less invasive application.
